content:
Congratulations on making progress on your bedtime routine! Training yourself to wake up at a consistent time can take some time, but with a solid plan and persistence, you can achieve your goal. Here are some tips to help you wake up at 7:00 AM without hitting the snooze button:

1. **Set a consistent wake-up time**: Set your alarm for the same time every day, including weekends. Consistency will help regulate your body's internal clock.
2. **Gradually adjust your wake-up time**: If you're not used to waking up at 7:00 AM, try setting your alarm 15-30 minutes earlier each day and gradually work your way up to your desired wake-up time.
3. **Improve your sleep environment**: You've already taken a great step by using a sleep mask to block out light. Consider making your sleep environment more sleep-conducive by keeping it cool, quiet, and dark.
4. **Establish a relaxing bedtime routine**: Develop a calming pre-sleep routine to signal to your body that it's time to wind down. This could include activities like reading, meditation, or a warm bath.
5. **Get some morning sunlight**: Exposure to natural light in the morning helps regulate your circadian rhythms, making it easier to wake up. Open your curtains or take a short walk outside in the morning.
6. **Use a smart alarm**: Consider using an alarm clock that can monitor your sleep patterns and wake you up during a light sleep phase, making it easier to wake up feeling refreshed.
7. **Avoid screens before bed**: The blue light emitted from screens can interfere with your sleep and make it harder to wake up in the morning. Try to avoid screens for at least an hour before bedtime.
8. **Make a plan for the morning**: Give yourself a reason to get out of bed by setting a goal or planning a enjoyable activity for the morning. This will help motivate you to get up and start your day.
9. **Use the 10-minute rule**: When your alarm goes off, give yourself 10 minutes to wake up and get out of bed. If you're still feeling tired, try stretching, jumping jacks, or a short morning exercise routine to get your blood flowing.
10. **Reward yourself**: Celebrate small victories by rewarding yourself for waking up on time. This could be something as simple as enjoying a favorite breakfast or taking a few extra minutes to meditate.

Additional tips:

* Avoid hitting the snooze button by placing your alarm clock across the room, so you have to get out of bed to turn it off.
* Try to avoid caffeine and electronics at least 30 minutes before bedtime to promote better sleep.
* Make sure you're getting enough sleep each night. Most adults need 7-9 hours of sleep.

Remember, it may take some time for your body to adjust to the new wake-up time, so be patient and don't get discouraged if you don't see immediate results. Stick to your routine, and your body will eventually adapt. Good luck!
